verb.description: Deprive (someone) of land, property, or other possessions.
examples: they were dispossessed of lands and properties at the time of the Reformation
a champion of the poor and the dispossessed
he used to ride out and dispossess his tenants as the spirit moved him

origin: Late 15th century: from Old French despossesser, from des- (expressing reversal) + possesser possess.
